docs.lead_paragraph: It’s time for self-absorbed Americans to recognize one another through universal health care.
docs.snippet: It’s time for self-absorbed Americans to recognize one another through universal health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Monday, President Obama outlined a legislative plan to overhaul health care. His blueprint, which tilts toward the Senate bill, is unlikely to win support from Republicans, or even be used as the basis for a compromise. Representative John Boehner of Ohio, the House Minority Leader, called the plan a "back room deal" that "doubles down on the same failed approach that will drive up premiums, destroy jobs, raise taxes and slash Medicare benefits."

headline.main: Can Obama Bypass Republicans on Health?

docs.abstract: The political risks of pushing through health care legislation without the G.O.P.
docs.snippet: The political risks of pushing through health care legislation without the G.O.P.

docs.lead_paragraph: The National Right to Life Committee, which opposes abortion rights, on Monday criticized President Obama's proposal to give the federal government new authority to review and potentially block premium increases by private health insurers.

headline.main: Anti-Abortion Group Opposes Increased Oversight of Premiums

docs.abstract: The National Right to Life Committee says that federal review of insurance premiums "limits rights of Americans of all ages to use their own money to save their own lives."
docs.snippet: The National Right to Life Committee says that federal review of insurance premiums "limits rights of Americans of all ages to use their own money to save their own lives."

docs.lead_paragraph: The director of the Congressional Budget Office, Douglas W. Elmendorf, said on Monday that the White House had not provided enough detail about President Obama's health care plan for the C.B.O. to make a full analysis.

headline.main: President's Proposal Lacks Sufficient Detail for Analysis, Budget Office Says

docs.abstract: The White House's health care proposal does not contain enough detail for a full analysis, the director of the Congressional Budget Office said on Monday.
docs.snippet: The White House's health care proposal does not contain enough detail for a full analysis, the director of the Congressional Budget Office said on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association is hammering back at President Obama's proposal to give the federal government new power to review, and potentially block, health insurance premium increases.
docs.abstract: The Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association pushed back against prospects of federal regulation of premium increases.
docs.snippet: The Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association pushed back against prospects of federal regulation of premium increases.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ever since President Obama floated the idea of a big televised forum on health care legislation, he has said that he first wanted to resolve differences between the bills already adopted by the House and the Senate so Democrats would have a single plan as a starting point in their discussion with Republicans.

headline.main: Boehner: White House Plan Cripples Summit Prospects

docs.abstract: The House Republican leader said the White House proposal proved that Democrats were committed to their own version of a health care overhaul.
docs.snippet: The House Republican leader said the White House proposal proved that Democrats were committed to their own version of a health care overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House, in advance of a televised summit meeting aimed at reviving revive stalled health care legislation, posted a proposal this morning that is meant to "bridge the differences," in the words of Dan Pfeiffer, White House communications director, between the House and the Senate bills. The White House basically follows the Senate bill, except that in a handful of key instances it weighs in with a Solomonic compromise. "We view this as the opening bid for the health meeting" that will be televised live this Thursday, said Mr. Pfeiffer.

headline.main: What Obama's New Health Care Plan Means for Small Businesses

docs.abstract: What's unclear at the moment is whether this proposal reflects the views of Democratic leaders in Congress - that is, whether this is a bill the White House hopes can pass, or thinks can pass.
